# jsreport-contrib-jira

[![Build Status](https:\x2F\x2Ftravis-ci.org\x2Fjsreport\x2Fjsreport-contrib-jira.png?branch=master)](https:\x2F\x2Ftravis-ci.org\x2Fjsreport\x2Fjsreport-contrib-jira)

\x3E [jsreport](https:\x2F\x2Fgithub.com\x2Fjsreport\x2Fjsreport) extension allowing to work with [jira npm module](https:\x2F\x2Fgithub.com\x2Fsteves\x2Fnode-jira) inside jsreport [custom scripts](http:\x2F\x2Fjsreport.net\x2Flearn\x2Fscripts).

This extension is pre-installed in jsreport [online](http:\x2F\x2Fjsreport.net\x2Fonline) version. You may install this extension to jsreport [on-prem](http:\x2F\x2Fjsreport.net\x2Fon-prem) by:
```
npm install jsreport-contrib-jira
```

##Example
Once is `jsreport-contrib-jira` extension running you can use `require('jira')` inside your custom scripts.

Simple example of getting jira issues for particular user.

```javascript
JiraApi = require('jira').JiraApi;
var jira = new JiraApi('https', '[subdomain].atlassian.net', 443, 'username', 'password', '2');

jira.getUsersIssues('pofider', true, function(err, res) {
    request.data = res;
    done();    
});
```

And then display the issues using `jsrender`
```html
{{for issues}}
    \x3Ch3\x3E
        \x3Cimg src='{{:#data.fields.status.iconUrl}}' \x2F\x3E 
        {{:#data.key}} - 
        {{:#data.fields.summary}}
    \x3C\x2Fh3\x3E
    \x3Cp\x3E
        {{\x3E#data.fields.description}}
    \x3C\x2Fp\x3E
{{\x2Ffor}}
```

For full set of jira api features see [node-jira documentation](https:\x2F\x2Fgithub.com\x2Fsteves\x2Fnode-jira).
